what: Convert Formatted Spreadsheets to Presentation-Ready Display Tables
title: Convert Formatted Spreadsheets to Presentation-Ready Display Tables
text: forgts reads spreadsheet formatting information produce gt tables cell text formatting input file. Text cell formats supported include: font face (bold, italic) font style (color, underline, strikethrough) cell fill cell borders (color width) Note formatting headers ignored intentionally package, cell text formatting added iteratively top gt defaults.

title: Apply Spreadsheet Formatting to gt Table — apply_styling
code: example_spreadsheet <- system.file("extdata/rodentsheet.xlsx", package = "forgts") sprdsht_data <- readxl::read_excel(example_spreadsheet) gt_table <- gt::gt(sprdsht_data) format_long <- get_formatting(example_spreadsheet) format_ready <- translate_defs(format_long) apply_styling(gt_table, format_ready)     measurement type       species       sex       CBL       LR     craniodental Abeomelomys sevia m 30.10 9.65craniodental Bandicota bengalensis f 39.41 11.21craniodental Chiruromys forbesi m 30.73 8.27craniodental Chiruromys forbesi m 34.46 8.13craniodental Chiruromys lamia m 29.56 8.13craniodental Chiruromys lamia m 27.45 7.13craniodental Chiruromys vates m 28.70 7.04
